s.text: (Also, you lovers of legacy applications should know that one of the reasons Windows 95 and Windows 98 are so "bloated" is so that they can run the old applications.)
(Also, you lovers of legacy applications should know that one of the reasons Windows 95 and Windows 98 are so "bloated" is so that they can run the old applications.)
The anti-bloat whiners would have you believe that Microsoft is coercing them into using our extralarded software products!
A fast car with a big noisy engine and a bone-crushing CD sound system.
Plus, it would be making smart connections between your data and actions.

My grouchy critics are ramping up again as the very large Office 2000 software suite hits the stores: "Shuman, why don't you and the other boy developers at Microsoft write some trim and tight code?"
or even my girlfriend says, "Hey, Shuman, why is Microsoft software so bloated, so full of junk, sucking up megs of space on my hard drive, hogging memory, and taking forever to load!
Your computer would have become the instantly searchable repository of all your correspondence, financial transactions, data searches, and phone conversations.
